item.title: Hardening Windows Clients with Microsoft Intune and Defender for Endpoint
item.description: As a major part of any corporate security program, vulnerabilities on corporate assets are required to be addressed, yet teams that solely focus on the patching aspects may be missing a key area of worry, insecure setup. Whether the asset’s configuration is unrestricted by default, or an operator has made a mistake, assets will end up in an unsecure configuration. Security teams with a proactive attitude will seek methods that automatically address asset misconfiguration, and, where possible, avert them in a centralized fashion.
